plan:
1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid aggressively up to my value to gather data about other bidders' strategies and tendencies.
2. Middle Rounds (4-6): Adjust strategy based on observed behavior. If others bid aggressively, bid conservatively to save money. If others bid conservatively, bid aggressively to win.
3. Late Rounds (7-10): Optimize strategy based on data gathered. If winning often, continue aggressive bidding. If not, switch to conservative bidding or try a mixed strategy, like bidding aggressively only when my value is high.

1. Start with conservative bidding up to 50% of the prize value to gather data on other bidders' strategies.
2. Increase to aggressive bidding up to 75% of the prize value to test their responses. 
3. Experiment with random bids within the range of 50-75% of the prize value to introduce unpredictability.
4. Analyze the data gathered to identify patterns in Andy and Charles' bidding behavior. 
5. Formulate an adaptive strategy based on their patterns: if they're conservative, bid higher; if aggressive, bid just below them.

1. Start with a conservative approach, bidding at 50% of the value. Observe competitor behavior.
2. Test a risky strategy by bidding at 80% of the value. Monitor the win rate and profit.
3. Experiment with an aggressive strategy by bidding at 95% of the value. Assess the profitability.
4. Try a variable strategy, bidding at 50-80% of the value based on previous round outcomes.
5. Analyze all data gathered, identifying patterns in competitor bidding and adjusting strategy accordingly.

Plan to test: Continue aggressive bidding in round 2 to gather more data. If my value is high, bid up to my value. If it's low, place a medium bid to analyze others' responses. In round 3, adjust strategy based on observed behavior from first two rounds.

Next, I'll test a mixed strategy. I'll bid conservatively (40-50% of value) if my value is low (below 15), and bid aggressively (60-80% of value) if it's high. I'll also introduce unpredictability by occasionally placing random bids within these ranges. This will help gauge competitors' reactions.

Plan to test aggressive strategy, bidding 90% of the value. Monitor competitors' behavior and adjust bid dynamically. Experiment with variable strategy, adjusting bid between 60-90% based on past outcomes. Analyze competitors' bidding patterns and adjust strategy accordingly. Aim to maximize long-term profits.

For round 3, I will bid moderately, slightly below my value. This strategy will allow me to observe other bidders' behaviors without risking too much. For rounds 4-6, I will adjust my strategy based on the data gathered from the first three rounds.

For the next round, I will implement a calculated aggressive strategy. If my value is high (above 15), I'll bid 60-80% of it. For lower values, I'll bid conservatively (40-50%). I'll also randomly vary my bids within these ranges to keep competitors guessing.

Plan to test a moderate strategy, bidding 70% of the value. Adjust bid between 50-70% based on past outcomes and competitors' behavior. Aim to balance risk and reward for long-term profit maximization.

Plan to implement a dynamic bidding strategy, adjusting between 65-85% of my value based on previous outcomes. Continue to analyze competitors' behavior to optimize bidding. Aim for profit maximization by balancing risk and reward.
